page.title: 10Local History
page.content: The name{Montrose}comes from the Gaelic "mon-ross" meaning mossy headland. There are reports of Viking attacks in the 10th century,but the discovery of a Pictish stone at Inchbrayoch shows a settlement existed before this time. Much of the Medieval Town was burnt down in 1244.The new town received a Royal Charter from David I in 1352. The Old Pretender left for France from {Montrose.} Famous people from{Montrose}include Joseph Hume,a politician and William Lamb,a famous sculptor. Before 1793 the only way across the River Southesk was by ferry.In 1793 a wooden bridge was built but collapsed in a gale in 1827.A new bridge was built in 1829,but was demolished in 1929.The present bridge was completed in 1931.
